# Commit Message Instructions

Generate standardized commit messages following Conventional Commits format.

## Format

```text
<type>(<scope>): <description>

<body>

<footer>
```

## Rules

- Use imperative mood ("add" not "added")
- Description MUST be less than 100 characters
- First line should be a complete summary

## Types

- `feat` - A new feature
- `fix` - A bug fix
- `refactor` - A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature
- `perf` - A code change that improves performance
- `style` - Changes that do not affect the meaning of the code
- `test` - Adding missing tests or correcting existing tests
- `docs` - Documentation only changes (excluding `*.instructions.md`, `*.prompt.md`, `*.chatmode.md`)
- `build` - Changes that affect the build system or external dependencies
- `ops` - Changes to operational components
- `chore` - Other changes that don't modify src or test files

## Scopes

Use one of these scopes when applicable:

- `(prompts)` - Prompt files
- `(instructions)` - Instruction files
- `(settings)` - Configuration/settings
- `(scripts)` - Script files
- `(build)` - Build configuration
- `(cloud)` - Cloud infrastructure
- `(edge)` - Edge computing
- `(tools)` - Tooling
- `(iot-ops)` - IoT Operations
- `(terraform)` - Terraform files
- `(bicep)` - Bicep files

## Body (Optional)

For larger changes, add a body after a blank line:

- Summarized bulleted list (0-5 items max)
- Less than 300 characters total

## Footer (Required)

- Include an emoji representing the change
- End with `- Generated by Copilot`

## Examples

Simple change:

```text
fix(scripts): correct path resolution in validation script

üîß
- Generated by Copilot
```

Larger change:

```text
feat(instructions): add markdown linting guidelines

- add code block language requirements
- add table formatting rules
- add blank line requirements around blocks

üìù
- Generated by Copilot
```
